description: Schema for `cloud_properties` section used by Availability Zones.

credentials_source.description: Selects credentials source between credentials provided in this configuration, or from an [IAM instance profile](http://bosh.io/docs/aws-iam-instance-profiles/).
credentials_source.title: Credentials Source

default_key_name.description: Name of the [Key Pair](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-key-pairs.html) that will be applied to all created VMs.
default_key_name.title: Default Key Pair

default_iam_instance_profile.description: Name of the [IAM instance profile](http://bosh.io/docs/aws-iam-instance-profiles/) that will be applied to all created VMs.
default_iam_instance_profile.title: Default IAM Instance Profile

max_retries.description: The maximum number of times AWS service errors (500) and throttling errors (`AWS::EC2::Errors::RequestLimitExceeded`) should be retried. There is an exponential backoff in between retries, so the more retries the longer it can take to fail.
max_retries.title: Max Retries

encrypted.description: Turns on [EBS volume encryption](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/EBSEncryption.html) for all VM's root (system), ephemeral and persistent disks.
encrypted.title: Enable Encryption

kms_key_arn.description: Encrypts the disks using an encryption key stored in the [AWS Key Management Service (KMS)](https://aws.amazon.com/kms/). The format of the ID is `XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX`. Be sure to use the Key ID, not the Alias. If this property is omitted and `encrypted` is `true`, the disks will be encrypted using your account's default `aws/ebs` encryption key.
kms_key_arn.title: Enable Encryption

title: Global Settings
